Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_Ch
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Flower Garden for 2 nights and I'm satisfied with my stay. The hotel is advertised as a 3 star hotel and pretty much lives up to the European standard of 3 star hotels, but it's more of a tourist, than business, hotel. It was clean, the rooms were not very spacious but large enough. The hotel is located within a walking distance from both Termini Railway Station and Plaza Republica metro. The neighbourhood has plenty of bars and restaurants. Staff was OK, although there was a mix up with getting a room with a double bed instead of twin bed and they wouldn't want to fix it because we were told that there are no more rooms with twin beds. We found out, however, that all the double beds are just two twin beds put together and we were able to fix it ourselves. One thing that I was dissapointed with was the breakfast, rather poor as for a 3 star hotel despite being quite expensive. For that price, you can have a much better breakfast in one of the local cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Cold Tiny Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: HaeleyK
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay here for 2 nights in March 2012, When we arrived at 10am on the Friday we were told our room was not ready so they would store our luggage, they then gave as a map an sent us on our way !!! We returned at 5pm, tired after a long flight, walking milesd round Colosseum, and hungry, we were told a pipe had burst so they had booked us into a different hotel next door called The Flower Garden. We had to stay there one night and return to them in the morning,. The flower garden was tiny, the room had 2 small single beds, tiny shower and was dark and dull, we did get a quiet comfy night though but hadnt payed for a small twin room. Breakfast was crossients cake or cereal or slices of bread !!!! We went back to the Impero the following day as told to do so and they held our bags again as room was not ready. returned at around 4pm and our room was big and all marble but extremly cold and damp with no tv and no shower only a bath which was horrible, This also had single beds which were hard uncomfortable and wooden so noisy with even the slightest movement. At 2am we were woken by a horrific scary banging noise which frightened the life out of me but there was no explanation as to what this this could have been, could not get baack to sleep as there were noisey people in street and street cleaners! Would never stay at either hotel here again !!!

Reviews.Title: “A mediocre experience in a fabulous city”
Reviews.Author: gianntrip
Reviews.Content: This hotel really disappointed me! Although its location was in a very convenient point, the service wasn't satisfying at all! The bathroom was so narrow, you couldn't actually turn your body or raise your hands in order to be washed! Furthermore, there was an annoying deep noise occasionally that didn't let you to rest...

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: MeghanB88
Reviews.Content: We got a good rate here so booked before we came to Rome. It was in a good location (close to the train station) so that worked for us. Although we were not looking for luxury (the small room with bathroom worked out for us) it was mediocre. My two complaints are that the front desk guys smoked and the whole place smelled of smoke, including the towels etc. A bit gross... Also, the breakfast (that we got included) was pretty bad. Yogurt from a machine, bad coffee, and stale pastries. Blah

Reviews.Title: “Don't let this terrible hotel ruin your Rome vacation”
Reviews.Author: YoungCouple1111
Reviews.Content: Booked there for 3 nights in September and could not sleep due to the heat. The aircon does not work and the reception talk to you in Italian (pretentious). He will not transfer you to another room with good aircon; maybe all aircon is not working. I'm from the Philippines and I am used to hot weather. However if you are put in this hotel room with small window; it's like an oven. You can only sleep when you're mind is finally exhausted at 3am.... you wake up with a headache.... look at the hotel maps and there are lots of hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and quiet rooms in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Blueheron5
Reviews.Content: This is a somewhat characterless but good value hotel with all the facilities you are likely to need for a short stay in the city. The rooms are small but well appointed with ensuite facilities that were clean and modern. The hotel is well-located about 15 minutes walk from Termini (railway and metro station) and walking distance to the Colosseum or Trevi Fountain. The continental breakfast buffet is adequate (I would have welcomed fresh fruit) and the front desk helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ilovetraveling188590
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the main Roma Station around 5 to 8 minutes walk. The hotel was clean and staff was also helpful. The A/C also functioned (no cooling like other A/cs but atleast did not feel hot being Italy). The Breakfast is ok. We stayed for 3 Nights and had no Complaints at all. Rooms are a bit small but considering other points (like proximity to the Station, lots of Restaurants around and the Cost of Accommodation) that can be adjusted. We had a Pleasant stay. We reached before the Check in Time but our room was already ready for us..Over all a good Experience. We will not hesitate to stay here if we go to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: l_ben88
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Flower Garden Hotel for 3 nights & had a pleasant time. The location of the hotel is great – perfect for a sightseeing trip. It’s located a few minutes from Termini station and Republica metro station, with transport links that will take you virtually anywhere in Rome. The hotel/rooms are on the smaller side, though clean, comfortable & convenient – which was all we were after, nothing flash. We found the reception staff to be polite, fairly helpful and speak good English. The hotel is walking distance to pretty much everywhere in Rome and was a peaceful place to crash after a full on day of exploring. Apart from the tiny shower, we had nothing to complain about! The room air conditioning was a lifesaver (very much needed given the 40 degree heat we were travelling in!) Breakfast was included and was substantial - tea, coffee, pastries, boiled eggs, tinned fruits, spreads, cereal etc. Only a 10 min walk to both the Colloseum and the Trevi Fountain. We paid about 5 euro for 1 hour of wireless internet access. Overall we had a good stay (nothing to complain about) and will most likely stay here again if we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: ksamer
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in this hotel. The staff was helpful, they speak clear English. The rooms were a bit small, but clean and tidy. Also the room walls were covered with noise canceling cushion. The location is great; it is a waking distance to all attractions in central Rome and also close to the main metro station. Breakfast is great. For internet they only offer internet through prepaid cards which costs: 5 euro per hour, 10 euro for 3 hours, or 20 euro for 10 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Find another place to stay”
Reviews.Author: keylanna
Reviews.Content: Based on the hotel's description, I was excited to stay here, and I was very disappointed. The service was terrible. The no-smoking room I requested had a heavy scent of stale cigarette smoke and the windows were open to freshen the room. The towels were not changed daily. The staff was downright curt. I am not a demanding traveler. I just want a safe, clean place to stay and staff that is courteous and can answer a few questions. The Flower Garden Hotel was one of the worst I've experienced.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean”
Reviews.Author: bosmanli2482
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful for the price. It is only a 10 min walk to both the Colloseum and the Trevi Fountain with the Metro nearby as well. The rooms were very clean and an excellent breakfast was provided each morning. The only problem we had with this hotel was the service. Expect horrible service at this hotel. They were very snappy and rude. (However, there was one employee named Stefano who was wonderful. Cross your fingers he is at the front desk.) Overall though, it was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but staff leave a lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: passionflower2104
Reviews.Content: Great location within a few minutes of The Termini ,metro and the bus station.Easy to get to almost anywhere in Rome.Hotel and rooms clean. Small shower area . 2 areas let the hotel down and both concerned the staff,firstly their inability or refusal to control noisy guests in the public corridors late at night and secondly their lack of customer service... one simple question what times are the trains from the termini to the airport.... Phone and internet at his disposal ... and surely a question asked previously..met with a curt reply of "go to the train station and find out"....customer service can be the difference between returning to a hotel or not.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, very friendly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: carlaparry84
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small in a central location near to termini station. We spent 4 nights here in February. The room was clean and the staff on reception were helpful. It had a large ensuite bathroom and a television in the room. Continental breakfast was provided and there was a lot of choice; pastries, rggs, toast, cheeses, meat, jam and bread. The hotel was ideal for a city break and good value for money. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mullibull
Reviews.Content: The staff was really friendly, however they had no clue who they gave the roomkeys to. I just walked in, told them the number of my room and they gave me the key (not always my key....). The breakfast was good and I liked the location of the hotel. It was close to everything, great for people arriving by train (or taking the train from the airport like I did). Many restaurants in the area, close to the metro, the bus, walking distance to Colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!!!”
Reviews.Author: MikeB1234_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel has gotten bad reviews but after personally experiencing it i can honestly say it was a beautiful hotel! The room had aircon, very comfortable - private and quiet. The breakfast was sufficient with breads, cereals, fruit and juices as well as hot drinks. This hotel was located at walking distance to EVERYTHING - termini, attractions and cafes. All you'll be doing here is sleeping and getting breakfast - and the price was great for that purpose. It is like what we would consider a B&B, but extremely nice!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: MiguelCC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near Termini where we can find metro/bus/train. To someone who wants to walk the less possible with luggage and a central location it is the best location. Breakfast does not convince and air conditioner is really frustrating when you look desesperately for a cool brise. The person in charge is very nice and gives good advices about rome.

Reviews.Title: “More like a prison cell than a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dana007005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the end of March. The location is not great in my opinion - while it is close to Termini station, the area is not really nice and definitely not a charming place to stay at for a first visit in Rome. I am sure that better hotels can be found in the beautiful area of Campo di fiori or Piazza Navona. The room - the tiniest room I've ever stayed at, and I have stayed at 3 star hotels in Europe many times in the past. This is not a 3 star hotel. I would barely give it 1 star. There are better youth hostels than this hotel. The room wasnt very clean, the bathroom was horrible, the toilet had stains on it and it looked like it hasnt been changed in 20 year old, one towel had dark stains on it and you could not be mistaken about their origin! No privacy whatsoever, you hear everything from the corridor and you feel that anyone can hear what you say in the room. Breakfast - poor. We decided that there's no need to further punish ourselves and ate our breakfast elsewhere. Rome is so lovely, we had a great time, but I would DEFINITELY choose another hotel and pay an extra of 30-40 euros. Do not stay at this hotel, find a better basic 3 star hotel, in a better location. If you want to go out at night, this is not the place.. the main restaurants and bars are located in the center - trevi, navona, campo fi fiori etc.

Reviews.Title: “glorious rome”
Reviews.Author: altitudeCheshire
Reviews.Content: three days of sight seeing the best of rome. magical.now the hotel great location but you will find nearly all the hotels are located here.our room looked on to a flat roof wich was barred. a rusting motorbike lived on this roof plus many other parts we kept the curtains drawn basic breakfast bland interieor. because its rome there will always be guests here no matter what. we still enjoyed our break though

Reviews.Title: “great location - you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: hodgson92
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel in june of this year. the location was perfect, right outside the front of the hotel was pubs and cafes and there is also a little market where you can buy cheap food and drink. The Termini is 2 minutes away so if you are planning on travelling around a little bit by trains you dont have to worry about a long walk. In terms of the standard of hotel, the down stairs was basic, it has a small breakfast room with a little spread and tv, however all the staff are very helpful and when you check in they give you a map of the city so you can find your way around easier. they also have a place for you to store your cases if need be. The rooms were small but had everything you needed, tv hairdryer and a good bathroom. A couple of people have moaned and said not to stay here but being a travel agent and having stayed at alot of different hotels i would say that if you are looking for a base, just somewhere to sleep at night then stay at the hotel flower garden.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, that's all!”
Reviews.Author: passi0ntravel
Reviews.Content: After a 5 min walk from Termini and watching your pocket book around Termini, you'll get to this hotel. Very basic and not as nice as other 3 start hotels we stayed in Italy! Maybe a 1.5 or 2 stars in my opinion! Rooms were very small, long bathroom, rusty bath tubs, cheap amenities but not so cheap to stay! This hotel could use renovation. Rooms were so small that forces you to just change clothes and get out! Noticed they did not change sheets and just remade bed. Breakfast was very very basic with instant coffee machine and pre-packaged Croissant!! Milk, cheese, and boiled eggs was sitting out all morning and warm! There was a tiny elevator, which is another plus. Location was really good, walking distance to Republica, and other fountains, close to train to go to Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Dont go to the bathroom, go somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Renemx
Reviews.Content: Dirty, book somewhere else, more then two weeks in europe, small rooms, nice hotels and clean, util we got to flower garden hotel rome, not even the bed was clean.The toilet was not clean..you know what I mean.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean & tidy”
Reviews.Author: WALESRUGBYFAN
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we had to stay in a different hotel for the first of our three nights because of over booking. The room in hotel flower garden was very small but nicely decorated, the bathroom was adequate & clean.Breakfast very basic no meats just bread cheese jam & cereal. Resturant nearby in tower (sorry cannot remember name but you can't miss it) poor food and extremely overpriced. Must shop around for good food & value for money. Druids rock irish bar fantastic as usual excellent staff, sensibly priced drinks compared to some bars.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: zuzi2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Flower Garden hotel for 3 nights at the end of March, 2009. We were very impressed by the staff as they were vey friendly and helpful. The rooms are nice, not very big but not too small, very cozy and comfortable (the beds are excellent). Very clean, the rooms are cleaned every day. The bathroom was spacious. The American Breakfast is ok, the croissants and donuts are absolutely delicious, but if you don't eat cereals with milk, cheese, boiled eags and jam for breakfast, you might have a problem. Very near to Termini station (2 minutes walk), is very easy to reach the city center (only 2 metro station till the Colloseum or 30 - 40 minutes walk). We really felt very well in this hotel and we will definetely return (hopely in the summer).

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: PMGBuc
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent-very close to Termini and a few minutres from Santa Maria Maggiore. The personnel is very nice, kind and helpful. The rooms are small, the bathrooms are different sizes (some very small, some bigger) and the furniture classic. There is just one small elevator in the hotel (it is enough considering that it is a small hotel) and also a minibar in the room. The main problems are regarding the breakfast (cold and few choices-good coffee anyway) and the fact that the house-keeping doen't do a very good job!!! If you don't spend much time in the hotel, it is ok, but if you want something above average, choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: rnlmcs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the train and bus station. Also at the bus station is a Hop on and Off tour bus. This is most convenient way to see the sights, a two day pass is perfect, cheaper than bus fare. We noted the rooms are small, bathrooms okay, the hotel is immaculate. The breakfast is the usual european continental breakfast. The desk help is most helpful with directions. I would stay again if but only for the convenience

Reviews.Title: “Basic base”
Reviews.Author: Ladidoh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Flower Garden Hotel, as part of a round-the-world honeymoon. It was basic and generally comfortable, except for the bathroom (let's just say it was easier to keep the shower doors open than fight them). The staff were professional and friendly, and the breakfast was okay (lots of sweet food, but most importantly coffee was there). The hotel is close to Termini and within walking distance (if you dare cross the road) of all of the major attractions. We would stay there again, but would not recommend it if you are looking for an amazing experience (be warned fellow honeymooners and romantics alike).

Reviews.Title: “Severe mold problem. Do not book with Go Today.”
Reviews.Author: Marshelle
Reviews.Content: The bathroom had a severe mold problem on the ceiling and in the shower which made us hesitant to shower regularly. The staff was extremely helpful and the location was good. Booked with Go Today and paid for an upgraded hotel. Very disappointed because we met other american tourists who booked with the same agency with no upgrade in same location of Rome but their hotels were far superior to ours. Do not recommend booking with this travel agency.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: purcy23
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a weekend in rome and stayed at the flower garden hotel. the hotel is in an excellent location-5 minute walk from termini station. the hotel staff were very helpful and friendly and gave us directions to various sites and told us where the best places to eat are.the room wasn't very big but it was clean and warm, we had a shower,bath,minibar,tv. the breakfast was better than i expected- cereals, juice, eggs,croissants,bread and tea and coffee, it was sufficient for us. i would recommend this hotel and i would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price (thin walls)”
Reviews.Author: andychem18
Reviews.Content: Great location only a few minutes walk from Termini Station, so very handy for getting to/from the coach transfer to Ciampino. this also means that you can access Rome's bus and underground train network so the Vatican is within easy reach. You can also walk to the centre of Rome in 10-15 minutes all down hill as well. there are plenty of places to eat near by some good and some not Est,Est, Est was the best we found. just down the street directly opposite the hotel. talking of food the breakfast served in the hotel is a good continental mix, cereal, bread, cheese, pastries etc. the room we got was small but big enough for what you need no bath though, just a full sized shower. still do you need a big room in Rome because why would you want to spend hours in the room when there is so much to see in the city. the only down side was the paper thin walls. i could even hear the person in the next room snoring at night. so if you are a heavy sleeper you'll be ok, if not take some ear plugs !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Star Gang in friendly Rome”
Reviews.Author: Surreytraveller1
Reviews.Content: Four friends stayed at this hotel at the beginning of November 2007. We were looking for a hotel that gave us value for money, close to the center of Rome with easy access to the transport system (coach transfer with Terravision from Ciampino 13.50 euros booked in advanced) and in a location that took us away from the hurly burly of a busy capital city in the evening, this we found in the Flower Garden. You only get what you pay for in this world and if your looking for 4-5 * accommodation at the prices the hotel charges you are not going to find it here, but if your doing Rome on a budget, super. The rooms are adaquate, although the bathroom we had was a little on the small side, but clean and it all worked. Breakfast is your typical european fare, cereal, cheeses, pasteries, rolls and jams with plenty of coffee and tea. The staff were polite and helped us with all our questions and directions. There are plenty of restaurants and bars in the local area at reasonable prices, The Roof Garden Restaurant next door was welcoming and plenty of fun, full of locals, always a good sign in any country. The Washington Bar opposite can be a little expensive. Pop into the bar adjoining the hotel for a beer and a coffee. Lovely. We didn't expect to much, but all four of us were pleasantly surprised. We did Rome and loved it.

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: AngleseySam
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the is hotel for a week at the beginning of July with my Mum, it was a birthday surprise from me for her. We enjoyed our time in Italy. The hotel is in a good location, within walking distance of most tourist attractions; colloseum, trevi fountain, spamish steps etc. Within walking distance were plenty of places to eat at night. The room we had was a twin room, at first we were on the same side as the main street we can be quite noisy late into the night and from early in the morning. After our first night my Mum explained to the hotel staff that I was pregnant and needed a good nights sleep, they changed us to a miuch better room without any hassle. The room was clean and tidy and had everything you needed. The breakfast was very god also, basic yet plenty of choice. I would reccomend this hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lea85
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel for 6 nights. The room was clean, the breakfast was above our expectations, while the other 2-3 stars hotels serve a little croissant with a cup of coffee in Flower Garden you get few types cakes, coffee, cornflakes, cheese, bread, eggs... The staff is very friendly and helpful, and the location is great: a walk distance from many attractions and a 2 minutes walk from the central train station Termini (so it's easy to reach the hotel from the Fiumichino airport). Via Nazionale , a central street with many shops including a grocery store, is just near by. To conclude, a great hotel for travelers with a limited budget.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Clean”
Reviews.Author: rcbok
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Flower Garden for 6 nights over last Thanksgiving week as part of a air/hotel combo package we booked through Air-France Holidays for a great $ deal. We really enjoyed our visit. The room was clean, although a little small-we checked the pics online other travelers had submitted so we weren't surprised. The bed was very firm, but we like that. There is a scooter rental shop next door and a restaurant, so I would recommend ear plugs. The staff was very friendly. The bathroom in the room was huge, half as big as the bedroom, and the only complaint was that the shower was outdated and a lttle musty-wear shower shoes. We got exactly what we were looking for, a no frills hotel in a great location for a great price. When you go to Rome you should spend as little time in the hotel as possible anyway-there's so much to see.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: ArkansasGardener
Reviews.Content: We were switched to the Impero which is just a couple of doors down. The room was fine. We were on the fourth floor and we had no trouble with noise. The room was clean and neat. The bathroom was quite small but in good shape and clean. Desk clerks were helpful if asked but not very forthcoming.

Reviews.Title: “never again!”
Reviews.Author: dinha
Reviews.Content: It was disappointing, the pictures I saw in the net were actually very different, I did not think it was clean, the plates and cups on breakfast were not clean, there were cigarette stains on the pillow case, mattress…and the worst, after 2 hours we had checked inn some one knocked the door 2 times and tried to open the door of the room we had to hold the door to the person don’t go inside, and scream that had people inside in the end was someone of the staff wanting to see if we knew how to use the heather, why not use the phone or wait to someone open the door? Not nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect base for Roman exploration!”
Reviews.Author: Owenworld
Reviews.Content: Recently enjoyed a week's honeymoon at the Flower Garden Hotel, (January 3rd-10th 2007). We are a young mid-20's couple and all i can say is that this hotel was absolutely perfect. As long as you don't expect too much luxury (or space), you will not be disappointed. We stayed in room 208. It was indeed small but not unpleasantly so. It was very clean and the bathroom was absolutely fine, although the shower was quite small, fine if you are an average build but maybe problematic if you are a fairly wide person. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly. For instance, my wife and I developed a naughty habit of returning to the hotel very drunk at 3-4am in the morning, having to knock on the door to get in. The night staff never said a word, just smiled and handed us the key. So no problems there! The breakfast was pretty basic but enough to set you up for the day. And best of all, above everything else is the location. The immediate area surrounding the hotel felt very safe indeed. There were ATMs close at hand and a fabulous restaurant called Est! Est! Est! (serving great big pizzas for 5-8 euros) just along the left-hand side of the road opposite the hotel. Also, there's a cosy Irish pub called The Fiddler's Elbow about a 6-minute walk from the hotel (just passed the Santa Maria Maggiore Church). It's a great little place to meet local Romans and other travellers. And that's not all - this hotel is in walking distance of nearly all the major tourist sites. The only time we caught the metro was to visit the vatican which is across the river (although even this is not very far). Other than that, we walked everywhere and I strongly advise you to do the same for this city is breathtaking at every turn and some of the greatest sites are those stumbled upon. (If you walk down to the Forum, there's a great ice cream parlour named La Dolce Vita on the left side of Via Cavour. Huge portions for 2.50 euros). To summarize, this hotel is excellent. OK, it's not the Ritz but it is still suprisingly well maintained and faultlessly clean. The location is very safe and astoundingly convienient, close to the train station and all the attractions. My wife and I were also a little dubious reading the reviews but were thoroughly delighted when we arrived. Therefore, I whole-heartedly recommend it. Enjoy! P.S. There's a great little cafe underneath the hotel a door down. Cheap coffee for 1.25 euros a cup and an awesome collection of wines and spirits. Don't go to the Washington cafe opposite. Two coffees there cost us 10 euros!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean room reaonably priced and superb location”
Reviews.Author: oannn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the central train station. The rooms are clean, although a little noisy. The staff are wonderful particularly the night manger, Carlo Pane. He is one of the nicest people you can meet, extremely helpful. The breakfast is okay. Overall this is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Flower Garden - just OK”
Reviews.Author: tpagatoralumni
Reviews.Content: The Flower Garden is very reasonable, clean and save. My boyfriend and I were traveling on a budget and out of season. The only concern I have is that the bed was extremely hard, like sleeping on a brick. If anyone has back problems and needs something softer, don't book here. The location was convenient to the train station, metro, and bus stops. We walked almost everywhere though and didn't feel like we were that far away from the sites. If you want a place where you can just walk a block to go eat, this wouldn't suit you either. I don't think I'd stay here again, just because I'd probably want to pay more for a softer bed.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: dol_trouble
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as we were on a strict budget so did not expect much. However, we were pleasently surprised at how good it was. The rooms were small but very clean and just enough for the amount of time we were there. Staff were tip top, all were very helpful and despite some language barriers all went out of their way to help give us tips and advice for our exploring. Breakfast was basic but again adequate. This hotel is perfect for the less snobbish, first time traveller or people who are exploring Rome and need a central base, location is perfect! Would definatly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Charlie-1000
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from 4 day stay. The hotel's in a brilliant position. There's some very good restaurants around, but avoid 'filli crisciotti' in Via D'azeglio just down the road from the hotel. Apart from the fact that it was the worst service we recieved anywhere in Rome, (halfway through starter when the main course arrived) one of our party had our bag snatched from the table right in front of four of us, and the restaurants reaction was "It happens, here is your bill". Nobody seemed to know where the police station was, including Flower Garden Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very basic budget”
Reviews.Author: EJH20
Reviews.Content: Just back from staying in Flower Garden- location is the only positive thing about this hotel. Breakfast v. poor lukewarm coffee, stone cold boiled eggs, bread as tough as old boots+ watered down orange juice. Rooms tiny, air conditioning I was informed did not start until JUNE !!! not much use to me in April. So much for satelite tv - 1 english channel - cnn. The bathroom was small but ok except for bad smell of sewage had to keep door shut all the time (towels were just average nothing to rave about+ they smelt of vinegar?). The wardrobe had 5 coat hangers none that you could hang trousers on + one shelf - no drawers. Now for the location excellent + safe I travelled with 4yr old son + my mother + her friend who needs a walking stick did not feel afraid of area at all at night. Superb little resturant across street + down some steep stairs its called Tattoria La Grotta Anatriciana very good value + food all freshly prepared -salads + steak particularly good. And strange as this may seem also v. good for fresh food + cheap is the upstairs resturant at the train station. Best coffee + ice cream can be found downstairs ( in train station also) at Moko bar cafe - cappuccino only 1.10 euro. We travelled to Florence on train for the day - worth a visit if you have time. We also went to Naples + across to Capri for the day. Both train jounerys good value for money + on time + clean. I could NOT recomend Greenline shuttle tours 22euro's very poor commentry for local attractions + lets face it ROME has so much to offer. Hope someone will find this useful WE HAD A WONDERFUL HOLIDAY except for hotel but as we only put our heads down at night ( + I have to say it was clean in room) it did'nt matter too much about hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget stay”
Reviews.Author: linc82
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Flower Garden for three nights in late March. We were apprehensive about the neighborhood due to reviews here...but felt very safe at all hours, and so did she, although my mother has never been to Europe before. The only downside was that the room was a little noisy due to the busy street outside- but any city hotel will likely have that. There is a tea room/pub and a restaurant across the street. Our room was on the third floor- it was clean, and yes, there was only one outlet which was behind a desk, but we are two women and still didn't have a problem. The shower was small, but really more than enough room for an average person. (The hotel we stayed at in Paris for the rest of the week had a bathroom about half the size.) The room was always kept tidy and breakfast was generally good- hard-boiled eggs, rolls and jams, coffee and croissants. The management was always friendly and accomodating even though we speak very little Italian. Overall, I would recommend the Flower Garden for budget travelers who need a basic room with a convenient location. Do not be dissuaded by the area- it is in fact very safe and easy to find after a long day's walk in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Can't believe the range of opinions on this hotel! My experience: average facilities, small room, shower was definitely tiny but I'm quite large & managed OK. Everything was clean, including the breakfast room, which was pleasant and cheerful despite the constant rain and lack of sun. This was not the Via Veneto, but my sister and I were out and around the neighborhood late at night with no problems, as stores and restaurants were open, lots of people around. What would send me back was the wonderful staff, especially the manager Mr. Lupo. I was travelling with a dozen 30-lb. boxes of dialysis solution which he kindly stored in the kitchen and had delivered to my room as needed. He also made arrangements for my sister & me plus the remaining 9 boxes to be driven to our next destination (costly but wonderful). Mr. Lupo spoke perfect English, made various phone calls for us, and was always more than pleasant, as were the rest of the staff. Whoever was at the desk greeted us, enquired about our day, chatted, were genuinely friendly. I would recommend the Flower Garden to anyone who is not looking for a luxury hotel. P.S. from front of hotel proceed straight ahead for one block, on right corner you will find a shop filled with Venetian glass and Sicilian pottery, excellent quality at exceptional prices.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: iris333
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the flower garden for 4 nights. Of course we did not expect much for he price we paid but it was pretty grotty. We were not pleased when we were put in a room the first night which was for 3 people and told we would have to move rooms the day after - so we could not settle in and unpack. We too had the worlds smallest shower. The next room had a shower over the bath which was easier to move about in. We were disapponted to find there was no plug sockets for charging up our phones etc. apart from the one for the t.v. which meant we had to move a big cabinet out of the way and break our back bending down to it. The bed cover here was disgusting, all sort of sweat stained, though the rest of the room was clean. Breakfast was pathetic as i think someone below has described - there was noone around at breakfast time, the tables we sat at were dirty most mornings, my mum wanted a cup of tea but there was no-one to ask. Staff in general were pretty unhelpful and loathed to speak any english. The few information leaflets in the reception were out of date. The area certainly is convenient for the main termini station but it is an awful area! We have never seen so many unsavoury characters in our lives - we were terrified out at night, and fairly scared in the daytime. The whole area was dirty - littered and bin bags piled up on the street. Not a place for 2 ladies on their own. And the place was full of tramps and beggars, they would defaecate in the gutter in full veiw of everyone in broad daylight - yuk.If i came back to Rome - which I don't think I will, I won't be staying at the flower garden.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm....it was okay”
Reviews.Author: TRIPTravelTailor
Reviews.Content: We weren't expecting much from the Flower Garden hotel, and we weren't disappointed. It's true that it's clean and the staff are friendly, so that's great. The room was teensy weensy, but had most of what we needed. We were happy to have our own bathroom, but after trying to maneuver around in the world's tiniest shower stall for three days, we were relieved to move on! It's true about the huge, fluffy towels, though - those were super. The breakfast was pretty unmemorable - it had one type of cereal, hard-boiled eggs, rolls/croissants and cheese or jam spreads. I think that was it. Same every day. We thought the location was great, though - close to Termini, but also walking distance to all the big sites. We never took public transport; just walked six or seven hours a day - it was fantastic. And the FG provided a clean, safe place to lay our weary heads at the end of the day, which is really all we needed.

Reviews.Title: “A budget hotel as expected but great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Flower Garden is everything one would expect from a budget hotel. For the price we paid we expected a clean room, working bathroom, a convenient location, and received exactly that. The hotel is within just a short walking distance from the Rome Termini train station where my bf and I were able to hop on a train to Florence just for the day. If you are looking for a luxurious hotel with all the amenities then the Flower Garden would not be your cup of tea. For those adventurous travelers who expect little more than a clean place to sleep for the night at a bargain price, then the Flower Garden may just work for you.

Reviews.Title: “Another true review”
Reviews.Author: MikeJHUD
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 6 day break at the Flower Garden in Central Rome.We had heard a few things about the hotel on this site prior to our visit and were wary! Breakfast is an average continental spread with bread, cheeses, fruit, danish pastries, boiled eggs etc. To be honest Ive had worse B&Bs in the UK! Overall I would say this is probably a value for money hotel - Its clean (towels, sheets changed 3 times in out visit), its central (about 200 yards from a metro)- staff were generally friendly with a number of resteraunts in near reach (tip: Good resteraunt opposite and down stairs main reception (Alessio?) - DON'T got to the L'Europa Bar and Resteraunt - everything is re-heated via microwave!) There is also a lovely bar/cafe next to the hotel (nice house wine - 'Vino dell Casa!' and original home cooked specials!) There is some road noise outside (there is in ANY central city location) but did not stop me from sleeping! If you are travelling by EasyJet and their Terravision bus transfer this is ideal as the bus drop off point is about 350 yards away! If we went back to Rome we would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ValCart
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 4 days stay at the Flower Garden and I went with a certain amount of trepidation having read the mixed reviews on this site. However I was pleasantly surprised. We had a large room with double and single bed and a good bathroom with a shower with lots of hot water and high pressure. Admitedly it was small inside the shower area but fine for me. Towels were large bath sheets and thick and fluffy (much better than the thin small ones we have had in other European places). Breakfast was more than adequate and helped along by a smiling waitress. Reception staff were helpful especially as my husbands suitcase did not make it to Rome. They helped ring Ciampino airport to try and trace it. Restaurants in the area were adequate although not exciting. Location of hotel is great for railway and for Metro and I would stay here again another time
